1.name: Chili-Cheese Nachos
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
2. Cook beef, onion, bell pepper and garlic in a large skillet over medium-high heat, crumbling the beef with a spatula, until the meat is browned, 8 to 10 minutes.
3. Stir in chili powder, cumin, oregano and coriander; cook, stirring, for 30 seconds.
4. Add tomatoes (with their juice) and water and simmer for 5 minutes.
5. Top chips with the chili and cheese. Bake until the cheese is melted, about 7 minutes.

2.name: Tortilla Pepperoni Pizza
instructions: 1. Preheat oven 425 degrees F.
2. Place tortilla on a baking sheet.
3. Combine tomato paste, Italian seasoning and garlic powder in a small bowl.
4. Spread the mixture over the tortilla.
5. Top with mozzarella, bell pepper and pepperoni.
6. Bake until the cheese is melted and the edges of the tortilla are crisp, 8 to 10 minutes.

3.name: Black Bean Tacos
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
2. Mash half of the beans in a large bowl.
3. Add whole beans, cumin and garlic powder; stir to combine.
4. Fill each taco shell with about 1/3 cup of the bean mixture. Top with cheese.
5. Place the filled tacos on a baking sheet and bake until the beans are hot and the cheese is melted, 12 to 15 minutes.

4.name: Oven-Fried Beef Taquitos
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
2. Shred zucchini using the large holes of a box grater.
3. Squeeze dry in a clean kitchen towel (you should have about 2 cups).
4. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
5. Add the zucchini, beef, chili powder, onion powder, cumin and salt.
6. Cook, stirring, until the beef is cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes.
7. Spread tortillas out on a baking sheet in two overlapping rows.
8. Bake until hot, 2 minutes. Transfer to a plate and cover.
9. Coat the baking sheet with cooking spray. Place 6 tortillas on a clean cutting board.
10. Working quickly, spread a generous 1/4 cup beef mixture along the bottom third of a tortilla, sprinkle with about 1 tablespoon cheese and tightly roll into a cigar shape.
11. Place the taquito seam-side down on the baking sheet.
12. Repeat with the remaining tortillas, filling and cheese.
13. Generously coat the top and sides of the taquitos with cooking spray.
14. Bake the taquitos until browned and crispy, 14 to 18 minutes.

5.name: One-Pot Spinach, Chicken Sausage & Feta Pasta
instructions: 1. Heat oil in a large straight-sided skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Add sausage, onion and garlic; cook, stirring often, until the onion is starting to brown, 4 to 6 minutes.
3. Add tomato sauce, spinach, pasta and olives; cook, stirring often, until bubbling hot and the spinach is wilted, 3 to 5 minutes.
4. Add 1 to 2 tablespoons water, if necessary, to keep the pasta from sticking.
5. Stir in feta and basil, if using.

6.name: Easy Chicken Enchilada Casserole
instructions: For Chicken
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. Place chicken in a large bowl. Add oil, garlic, salt and oregano; toss until well coated.
3. Arrange the chicken on the prepared pan. Roast until cooked through, 18 to 22 minutes.
For Pepper and Onions
1. Heat oil in a large straight-sided sauté pan or Dutch oven over medium heat.
2. Add peppers, onions and salt; cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender and starting to brown, 18 to 21 minutes.
For meal:
1. Stir tomatoes, cumin, chile powder and salt together in a medium bowl.
2. Coat a 7- or 8-by-11-inch casserole dish with cooking spray.
3. Spoon 1/2 cup of the tomato sauce into the bottom of the prepared dish.
4. Arrange 1/3 of the tortilla wedges over the tomato sauce.
5. Top with half of the beans, half of the chicken and half of the pepper mixture.
6. Top with 1 cup sauce and 1/2 cup cheese. Layer on half the remaining tortillas.
7. Top with the remaining beans, chicken and pepper mixture.
8. Top with 1 cup of the sauce and 1/2 cup cheese.
9. Layer on the remaining tortillas, followed by the remaining sauce (about 1/3 cup).
10. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Cover with foil and refrigerate until ready to cook, up to 3 days.
11. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
12. Bake the casserole, uncovered, until hot and bubbling, 35 to 40 minutes.
13.  (Alternatively, microwave the casserole, covered with wax paper, on Medium-High until steaming hot, 12 to 15 minutes.) Serve hot.

7.name: Classic Beef Burgers with Cauliflower Buns
instructions: For Buns
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.
2. Place cauliflower in a food processor; process until very finely grated. Transfer to a microwave-safe bowl.
3. Cover loosely and microwave on High for 3 minutes. Let cool slightly.
4. Transfer the cauliflower to a clean kitchen towel and wring out all excess moisture. Return to the bowl.
5. dd cheese and egg; stir until thoroughly combined.
6. Use a 1/4-cup measure to distribute the batter into 8 portions on the prepared pan.
7. Pat each into a 3-inch circle.
8. Bake until browned and crispy around the edges, 20 to 25 minutes. Transfer to a cooling rack and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
For meal:
1. Combine onion, 1 tablespoon oil and 1 tablespoon ketchup in a small saucepan.
2. Cover and cook over medium heat, stirring often, until the onion is softened, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer to a medium bowl.
3. Combine the remaining 1 tablespoon ketchup, mayonnaise, relish and vinegar in a small bowl. Set aside.
4. Add beef, Worcestershire and pepper to the onion mixture and gently combine without overmixing. Form into four 4-inch patties.
5. Heat the remaining 1 teaspoon oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
6. Add the burgers, reduce heat to medium and cook, turning once, until just cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes per side.
7. Assemble the burgers on buns with the ketchup mixture, tomato and lettuce.

8.name: Caprese Turkey Burgers
instructions: 1. Combine turkey, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, pepper and crushed red pepper in a medium bowl.
2. Form into 4 equal patties, about 4 inches in diameter.
3. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
4. Reduce heat to medium and add the burgers. Cook for 4 minutes.
5. Turn over and top each with a mozzarella slice.
6. Cover and cook until an instant-read thermometer reaches 165 degrees F, another 3 or 4 minutes.
7. Meanwhile, stir mayonnaise and chopped basil together in a small bowl. Place tomato slices on a plate and drizzle with vinegar.
8. Spread about 1 tablespoon of the mayonnaise mixture on the bottom of each bun. Top with a burger, two tomato slices and some basil leaves.

9.name: California Turkey Burgers & Baked Sweet Potato Fries
instructions: 1. To prepare fries: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
2. Slice sweet potato into 1/4-inch-thick matchsticks.
3. Place on a baking sheet, drizzle with oil, and toss to coat.
4. Sprinkle with 1/8 tsp. salt. Bake, flipping halfway through, until tender and crisp-edged, 20 to 25 minutes.
5. Meanwhile, prepare burgers: Using your hands, mix turkey, Cheddar, Worcestershire, garlic powder, pepper, and salt in a medium bowl.
6. Shape into two 4-inch patties, about 3/4 inch thick.
7. Brush oil over a medium nonstick or cast-iron skillet; set it over medium heat for 2 minutes.
8. Add the patties and cook for 2 minutes. Flip and cook for 2 more minutes.
9. Cover the pan and continue to cook until the patties are lightly browned but still juicy (the juices should run clear, not pink)
10. and an instant-read thermometer inserted in the center registers 165 degrees F, 2 to 4 minutes more.
11. To assemble the burgers, top each patty with a slice of onion and tomato, and half the avocado slices.
12. Carefully wrap each one in 2 to 3 lettuce leaves, wrapping as tightly as you can. Serve with the sweet potato fries.

10.name: Green Veggie Bowl with Chicken & Lemon-Tahini Dressing

11.name: Kung Pao Chicken with Bell Peppers

16.name: Crispy Baked Ravioli with Red Pepper & Mushroom Bolognese

17.name: Mac and Cheese with Chicken strips and Broccoli
